revised_title: Investigations on the Colouring Matters of Invertebrate Bile and their Comparison with Plant Chlorophyll
tldr: The author examines the colouring matters of invertebrate bile and discovers that a chlorophyll pigment, enterochlorophyll, is present in the bile of Mollusca, some Arthropoda, and the enteric appendages of Echinodermata. The author compares enterochlorophyll to plant chlorophyll using spectroscopy and chemical tests, concluding that they are identical.
